bug.author: superalino
bug.summary: Today I updated to last branch (git pull) and the script stopped working.
bug.description:
branch is up to date with 'origin/master'. <denchmark-h:h2>üêõ Bug</denchmark-h>
It worked until the last update (today). When I launch detect.py the script ends with errors On yolov3 branch I got no errors. <denchmark-h:h2>To Reproduce (REQUIRED)</denchmark-h>
python3 detect.py --weights weights/yolov5x.pt --classes 0 --conf-thres 0.70 --img-size=608 --source "/dev/shm/xxx/diolupo2" --output "/dev/shm/xxx/diolupo3" > /tmp/xxx.log Output: Unable to init server: Could not connect: Connection refused Unable to init server: Impossibile connettersi: Connection refused (detect.py:8350): Gdk-CRITICAL **: 22:05:59.047: gdk_cursor_new_for_display: assertion 'GDK_IS_DISPLAY (display)' failed /usr/local/lib/python3.7/dist-packages/torch/serialization.py:593: SourceChangeWarning: source code of class 'models.yolo.Model' has changed. you can retrieve the original source code by accessing the object's source attribute or set and use the patch tool to revert the changes. warnings.warn(msg, SourceChangeWarning) /usr/local/lib/python3.7/dist-packages/torch/serialization.py:593: SourceChangeWarning: source code of class 'torch.nn.modules.conv.Conv2d' has changed. you can retrieve the original source code by accessing the object's source attribute or set and use the patch tool to revert the changes. warnings.warn(msg, SourceChangeWarning) /usr/local/lib/python3.7/dist-packages/torch/serialization.py:593: SourceChangeWarning: source code of class 'torch.nn.modules.container.ModuleList' has changed. you can retrieve the original source code by accessing the object's source attribute or set and use the patch tool to revert the changes. warnings.warn(msg, SourceChangeWarning) /usr/local/lib/python3.7/dist-packages/torch/serialization.py:593: SourceChangeWarning: source code of class 'models.yolo.Detect' has changed. you can retrieve the original source code by accessing the object's source attribute or set and use the patch tool to revert the changes. warnings.warn(msg, SourceChangeWarning) Traceback (most recent call last): File "detect.py", line 161, in detect() File "detect.py", line 52, in detect _ = model(img.half() if half else img) if device.type != 'cpu' else None # run once File "/usr/local/lib/python3.7/dist-packages/torch/nn/modules/module.py", line 532, in result = self.forward(*input, **kwargs) File "/scripts/yolov5/models/yolo.py", line 100, in forward return self.forward_once(x, profile) # single-scale inference, train File "/scripts/yolov5/models/yolo.py", line 120, in forward_once x = m(x) # run File "/usr/local/lib/python3.7/dist-packages/torch/nn/modules/module.py", line 532, in result = self.forward(*input, **kwargs) File "/scripts/yolov5/models/yolo.py", line 27, in forward x[i] = self.m<denchmark-link:x%5Bi%5D>i</denchmark-link> # conv File "/usr/local/lib/python3.7/dist-packages/torch/nn/modules/module.py", line 576, in type(self)., name)) AttributeError: 'Detect' object has no attribute 'm' <denchmark-h:h2>Environment</denchmark-h>
Debian GNU/Linux 10 +-----------------------------------------------------------------------------+ | NVIDIA-SMI 440.82 Driver Version: 440.82 CUDA Version: 10.2 | |-------------------------------+----------------------+----------------------+ | GPU Name Persistence-M| Bus-Id Disp.A | Volatile Uncorr. ECC | | Fan Temp Perf Pwr:Usage/Cap| Memory-Usage | GPU-Util Compute M. | |===============================+======================+======================| | 0 GeForce GTX 1650 On | 00000000:08:00.0 On | N/A | | 58% 42C P8 9W / 75W | 79MiB / 3911MiB | 0% Default | +-------------------------------+----------------------+----------------------+ +-----------------------------------------------------------------------------+ | Processes: GPU Memory | | GPU PID Type Process name Usage | |=============================================================================| | 0 1138 G /usr/lib/xorg/Xorg 46MiB | | 0 1632 G /usr/bin/gnome-shell 30MiB | +-----------------------------------------------------------------------------+ <denchmark-h:h2>Additional context</denchmark-h>
Add any other context about the problem here.

comments.comment:
Hello <denchmark-link:https://github.com/superalino>@superalino</denchmark-link> , thank you for your interest in our work! Please visit our <denchmark-link:https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov5/wiki/Train-Custom-Data>Custom Training Tutorial</denchmark-link> to get started, and see our <denchmark-link:https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov5/blob/master/tutorial.ipynb>Jupyter Notebook</denchmark-link> <denchmark-link:https://colab.research.google.com/github/ultralytics/yolov5/blob/master/tutorial.ipynb></denchmark-link> , <denchmark-link:https://hub.docker.com/r/ultralytics/yolov5>Docker Image</denchmark-link> , and <denchmark-link:https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov5/wiki/GCP-Quickstart>Google Cloud Quickstart Guide</denchmark-link> for example environments. If this is a bug report, please provide screenshots and minimum viable code to reproduce your issue, otherwise we can not help you. If this is a custom model or data training question, please note Ultralytics does not provide free personal support. As a leader in vision ML and AI, we do offer professional consulting, from simple expert advice up to delivery of fully customized, end-to-end production solutions for our clients, such as:
Cloud-based AI systems operating on hundreds of HD video streams in realtime. Edge AI integrated into custom iOS and Android apps for realtime 30 FPS video inference. Custom data training, hyperparameter evolution, and model exportation to any destination.
For more information please visit <denchmark-link:https://www.ultralytics.com>https://www.ultralytics.com</denchmark-link> .

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/superalino>@superalino</denchmark-link> it appears you have environment problems. In order to run YOLOv5 correctly your environment must meet the minimum version requirements for the dependencies described in <denchmark-link:https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov5#requirements>https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov5#requirements</denchmark-link> . You can either update your local environment to bring it into compliance or you can use one of our verified environment options below. <denchmark-h:h2>Reproduce Our Environment</denchmark-h>
YOLOv5 may be run in any of the following up-to-date verified environments (with all dependencies including <denchmark-link:https://developer.nvidia.com/cuda>CUDA</denchmark-link> /<denchmark-link:https://developer.nvidia.com/cudnn>CUDNN</denchmark-link> , <denchmark-link:https://www.python.org/>Python</denchmark-link> and <denchmark-link:https://pytorch.org/>PyTorch</denchmark-link> preinstalled):
Google Colab Notebook with free GPU: Kaggle Notebook with free GPU: https://www.kaggle.com/ultralytics/yolov5 Google Cloud Deep Learning VM. See GCP Quickstart Guide Docker Image https://hub.docker.com/r/ultralytics/yolov5. See Docker Quickstart Guide
My fault. Script started to work again after a "pip3 install -U -r requirements.txt"
